intro: Ascarina lucida, commonly known as the kōwhai tree, is a native New Zealand plant belonging to the family Lygophyllaceae. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in spring, which are followed by distinctive, woody, cone-like fruits. Ascarina lucida is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. It plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
